I am particularly inspired by those who believe they are untouchable, who think their secrets are safe. Their eventual downfall, when it comes, is always more exquisite than imagined. The most powerful works are those that leave a mark, not just on the viewer, but on the victim. The lingering stain, the whispered rumors, the way a name becomes a cautionary tale—this is where art and consequence become one.

My inspiration is simple: the human condition, laid bare.
